com.mygdx.game.world

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mygdx.game.world.Map

  • public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
    Map class displays a map using tiles in a 2D array. Does not use a separate class for tiles, instead it uses a 2D array of boolean to tell between a space and a wall/block note: all coordinates are based on a bottom left origin Pixmap uses top-left-origin coordinates so adjustments are made
    Version:
    May 30, 2015
    Author:
    Nathan Lui, Period: 4, Assignment: my-gdx-game-core, Sources: Libgdx

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ARENA
      Generation type Arena
      static int DUNGEON
      Generation type Dungeon
      static int NUM_GENERATION_TYPES
      Number of Generation types
      static int OUTER_BORDER
      Determines how far the outer border is drawn (meant to cover black space)
      static java.lang.String PACKAGE
      Package for all images
      static int PIXELS_TO_TILES
      Conversion number from pixels to tiles
      static int RANDOM
      Sets generation to Randomly pick between the generation types
      static int SPAWN_DISTANCE
      Spawn distance from player in tiles

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Map(int rows, int cols)
      Constructs a map filled with walls Prepares Pixmap arrays for use in createMap() from predetermined files
      Map(int rows, int cols, boolean b)
      For JUnit Testing only (in order to avoid graphics: Textures and Pixmaps)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createMap()
      Creates the map image to be displayed based on areSpaces and Pixmap images created in the constructor Takes in consideration that Pixmap is based on a top left origin coordinate system and that rest of map is based on a bottom left origin coordinate system.
      void createRectangle(int x, int y, int w, int h)
      Sets all tiles in areSpaces in the outline of a box starting at x and y and formed by w and h to true.
      void createRoom(int x, int y, int w, int h)
      Recursively builds the room of the map where x and y are the starting points and w is the width and h is the height, uses a helper method with a new boolean[][] object
      void dispose()
      Dispose of all Resources to prevent memory leaks resources include any Pixmap variables and the map textures
      void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch)
      Draws the map, creates map if map Texture has not been created.
      void fillArea(int x, int y)
      Fills up all the spaces in a area (uses helper method to flood fill) Parameters x and y are the starting coordinate of the area to flood fill
      void generate(int type)
      Generates the map based on type of generation This method should be used instead of randomGeneration() as it will take in consideration all types of generations (this method is mainly for expansion of game generation)
      boolean[][] getAreSpaces()
      Method for testing only
      int getMapPixelHeight()
      Returns the map's height in pixels
      int getMapPixelWidth()
      Returns the map's width in pixels
      int getSpawnX()
      Returns suggested spawn location for player
      int getSpawnY()
      Returns suggested spawn location for player
      boolean hasPath(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, boolean asSpace)
      Returns whether point has a path to a second point Uses recursion with helper method to flood fill Creates a copy of the 2D boolean array in order to allow flood fill without modifying the main array.
      boolean inPixelBounds(float x, float y)
      Returns whether given pixel is in the map
      boolean inTileBounds(int x, int y)
      Returns whether given tile is in the map
      boolean isCollidingWithWall(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite s)
      Returns true if Sprite is in a wall, checks the sprite's bounding Rectangle with a created Rectangle to represent the walls near that sprite
      static int pixelToTile(float pixel)
      Returns the tile index of a coordinate given the pixel coordinate
      void randomGeneration(int type)
      Randomly Generates "rooms" in map where all the edges of areSpaces[][] remain "false" or walls
      static int randomNumber(int limit)
      Generates Random number from 0 inclusive to given limit exclusive
      void setSpawn(float x, float y)
      Sets the spawnX and spawnY, should be called before calling getSpawnX() and getSpawnY()
      int sizeOfArea(int x, int y)
      Returns the size of a area recursively using a helper method and flood fills a copy of areSpaces Creates a copy of the 2D array of booleans to flood fill.
      static int tileToPixel(int tile)
      Returns the pixel index of a coordinate given the tile coordinate
      java.lang.String toString()
      Written mainly for testing Returns String representation of this map with X representing walls and ' ' representing spaces.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public void generate(int type)
        Generates the map based on type of generation This method should be used instead of randomGeneration() as it will take in consideration all types of generations (this method is mainly for expansion of game generation)
        Parameters:
        type - of generation

      • createMap

        public void createMap()
        Creates the map image to be displayed based on areSpaces and Pixmap images created in the constructor Takes in consideration that Pixmap is based on a top left origin coordinate system and that rest of map is based on a bottom left origin coordinate system.

      • createRoom

        public void createRoom(int x,
              int y,
              int w,
              int h)
        Recursively builds the room of the map where x and y are the starting points and w is the width and h is the height, uses a helper method with a new boolean[][] object
        Parameters:
        x - -coordinate of top left of room
        y - -coordinate of top left of room
        w - width of room
        h - height of room

      • createRectangle

        public void createRectangle(int x,
                   int y,
                   int w,
                   int h)
        Sets all tiles in areSpaces in the outline of a box starting at x and y and formed by w and h to true.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        w -
        h -

      • sizeOfArea

        public int sizeOfArea(int x,
             int y)
        Returns the size of a area recursively using a helper method and flood fills a copy of areSpaces Creates a copy of the 2D array of booleans to flood fill. Parameters x and y indicate any coordinate in the room. If starting coordinate is not a space, this method returns 0.
        Parameters:
        x - starting x coordinate
        y - starting y coordinate
        Returns:
        number of spaces in area

      • fillArea

        public void fillArea(int x,
            int y)
        Fills up all the spaces in a area (uses helper method to flood fill) Parameters x and y are the starting coordinate of the area to flood fill
        Parameters:
        x - starting x coordinate
        y - starting y coordinate

      • hasPath

        public boolean hasPath(int x1,
              int y1,
              int x2,
              int y2,
              boolean asSpace)
        Returns whether point has a path to a second point Uses recursion with helper method to flood fill Creates a copy of the 2D boolean array in order to allow flood fill without modifying the main array.
        Parameters:
        x1 - x-coordinate of point 1
        y1 - y-coordinate of point 1
        x2 - x-coordinate of point 2
        y2 - y-coordinate of point 2
        asSpace - whether path should be a space or not - this parameter is only used as true currently, it is for expansion of generation capability purposes
        Returns:
        if there is a path from point 1 to point 2

      • isCollidingWithWall

        public boolean isCollidingWithWall(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite s)
        Returns true if Sprite is in a wall, checks the sprite's bounding Rectangle with a created Rectangle to represent the walls near that sprite
        Parameters:
        s - Sprite to check
        Returns:
        true if Sprite is in a wall

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch)
        Draws the map, creates map if map Texture has not been created. Uses OUTER_BORDER and a texture of the outer border to create an expanse (expanse covers dark areas outside of map with walls
        Parameters:
        batch - SpriteBatch used to draw the map

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Dispose of all Resources to prevent memory leaks resources include any Pixmap variables and the map textures
